chapter.title: Session 2: Summary
chapter.content:
Session 2 covered the following points:

  • The six key practices of deeper learning are:
    • Key Practice 1: Use multiple and varied representations of concepts and tasks
    • Key Practice 2: Encourage elaboration, questioning, and self-explanation
    • Key Practice 3: Engage learners in challenging tasks, with supportive guidance and feedback
    • Key Practice 4: Teach with examples and cases
    • Key Practice 5: Prime student motivation
    • Key Practice 6: Use formative assessment
  • The ability to apply academic knowledge and problem-solving skills to a variety of contexts and situations is at the core of deeper learning and knowledge transfer.

  • Intentional implementation of instructional methods and approaches that promote deeper learning can foster workforce preparation and employability skills.

  • Adult learners master lesson objectives best when workforce preparation and employability skills are explicitly contextualized in the lesson using authentic materials, real-life case studies and other contexts related to career exploration, careers in specific industry or occupational sectors, and daily life.

  • Contextualized lessons help students see how the skills they are learning can apply directly to situations and problems they might encounter in their current workplaces or educational pursuits.

  • There are many resources available to help you create contextualized lessons taught explicitly in the context of exploring various careers.

Continue to Course Conclusion and Evaluation.
